result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called @ 2:23 PM Defendant Wayne L. Jones appeared with Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow. Defendant appears via video from the WC Jail. Attorney Matthew Leusink appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives his right to be personally present in the courtroom. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. DA Leusink makes note of a correction to a date in the Information. Receipt admitted - reading waived. Defendant stands mute. NGP entered by the Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.

DE REFUSED TO SIGN BOND FORM

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 01:18 PM Defendant Wayne L. Jones in court with attorney Emma K Blankschein.  Defendant Wayne L. Jones in custody, appears via video from the WC Jail. Atty Blankschein appears telephonically.  Dennis J Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment. Oral amendment on the record correcting the date of violation on the criminal complaint. Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant is eligible to SPD services. Bond argument by ADA Ryan. Bond argument by Atty Blankschein. Court orders $7500 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 13, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
